before_start: {"blocks":[{"key":"7ou06","text":"The  protocol for labelling human tissue can be found here dx.doi.org/10.17504/protocols.io.n92ld8nxxv5b/v1.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ebk9e","text":"This protocol can be modified to be applied for other combinations of markers and fluorophores. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
description: {"blocks":[{"key":"9rl5m","text":"This protocol details the fluorescent image analysis pipeline using QuPath to analyse pathological inclusions within human post-mortem brain tissue.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
ethics_statement: {"blocks":[{"key":"a54c3","text":"Post-mortem brain tissue samples were obtained from Sydney Brain Bank (Sydney, Australia). Ethical approvals were acquired from the human research ethics committees of the University of Sydney (approval number: 2021/845). ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"57eb0","text":"\n","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7jcp6","text":"Application of this protocol will need  prior approval by the users' institutional review board (IRB) or equivalent ethics committee(s).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
keywords: ASAPCRN,post-mortem ,image analysis,human brain tissue,cell count,alpha synuclein,p62,tau

status.info: We use this protocol and it's working

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"de42m","text":"Post-mortem human immunofluorescent sections were scanned using an Olympus VS200 slide scanner at 20x for Quantification. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"mfs9","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c9msp","text":"Cell count and area measurements were completed on digital images using QuPath (version 0.5.1). The QuPath quantification protocol followed the steps listed below. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"98ufj","text":"For the midbrain, Substantia Nigra pars compacta (SNC) was divided into non-overlapping subregions: SNC dorsal tier (SNCD), SNC ventral tier (SNCV), SNC lateral tier (SNL), SNC medial tier (SNCM), using tyrosine hydroxylase (TH) positive cells as an anatomical landmark.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4uv2p","text":"For the cortex, the grey matter was divided into non-overlapping subregions: superficial grey matter (SGM) and deep grey matter (DGM), using HuD positive neurons as the guidelines. The white matter (WM) was categorized separately based on DAPI density and nuclear size.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Cell count: TH+ cell with/without aSyn+/Tau (AT8)+/p62+ signals
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"30udi","text":"The point tool was used to identify TH+ neurons if cells contain visible TH+ signal and/or neuromelanin.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b4a0h","text":"The point tool was used to identify aSyn+, AT8+, or p62+ signals based on cells recognised from step 1","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d8fa8","text":"Grid lines are then applied superimposed on the image to assist with cell counting and categorization using a counter.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1p6if","text":"Automated cell detection was used to recognize HuD+ cells. Parameters were optimized by comparing with manual counting until \u003c 10% variance was achieved.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"76b0t","text":"An object classifier was created to recognize HuD+ cells with/without aSyn+, AT8+, or p62+ signals. Parameters were optimized by comparing with manual counting until \u003c 10% variance was achieved. These object classifiers were then applied to the step 1 recognised HuD cells.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5kcki","text":"Automated particle detection was used to recognise aSyn+, AT8+, or p62+ particles. The minimal size of aSyn+, AT8+, or p62+ particles was set at 10mm2 to avoid of false counting. Parameters\nwere optimized by comparing with manual counting until \u003c 10% variance was achieved.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sup","offset":149,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7kogg","text":"The same object classifiers from the previous step 2 of the “HuD+ cell with/without aSyn+/AT8+/p62+” were applied to the aSyn+ and AT8+particles according to the order below: ","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"355dq","text":"         a.      aSyn + particle detection -\u003e AT8+ classifier and p62+ classifier applied sequentially","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2nuf8","text":"         b.      AT8+ particle detection -\u003e aSyn + classifier and p62+ classifier applied sequentially","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4ifs0","text":"Automated cell detection was used to recognize nuclei with DAPI. Parameters were optimized by comparing with manual counting until \u003c 10% variance was achieved.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

title: Image Capture and Neuropathological Quantification of post-mortem human brain tissue
title_html: Image Capture and Neuropathological Quantification of post-mortem human brain tissue
